info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:54AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Henderson, northern Warren, eastern Mercer and southwestern Henry Counties through 530 AM CDT... At 454 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burgess, or 8 miles southeast of Aledo, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monmouth, Burgess, Viola, Woodhull, Matherville, Alpha, Little York, Rozetta, North Henderson, Shale City, New Windsor, Boden, Lake Warren, Alexis, Coldbrook, Gerlaw, Monmouth Municipal Airport, Cameron, Sunbeam and Nekoma. This includes Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 30 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
